a65e6835-5eea-4438-bde6-42bfeffdbd65.description: A PAC Certified Independent Trainer helps others see dementia from the view of those living with it. A 10-20-minute video, with an audience of at least three people, demonstrating an Adult Experiential Learning Cycle (AELC) around an objective, along with a 5-10-minute coaching or consulting cycle with someone on the call based on the skill that was trained.
Live webinar with our PAC Team Leads who will provide feedback on your video.

Lead a 10-20-minute webinar, which will be recorded. At least three of our PAC Team Leads will be invited to this webinar. You will demonstrate the same objective and your ability to respond, rather than react, to questions in the moment, as well as your ability to take feedback.
Attend PAC Apprentice Days. You will rework and prepare the same objective with an AELC and secondary supporting cycle (Coach or Consultant) that you used for the entire process.
Attend a Certification course as learning mentor. Review and incorporate lead’s and PAC team’s training and feedback.
Attend a Certification course as support mentor. Review and incorporate lead’s and PAC team’s training and feedback.
Work one-on-one with lead mentor in leading sections of content. Review and incorporate lead’s and PAC team’s training and feedback.

During the PAC Champion 1 Course, attendees learned and practiced the PAC techniques of the Positive Physical Approach™ (PPA™) and Hand-under-Hand®. They practiced the use of these techniques in the three different scenarios of a person standing up, sitting down, and when approaching the person.

Describe the agenda and how to know the agenda without showing the agenda

Complete all steps of Positive Physical Approach®️ (PPA) correctly, including Hand-Under-Hand®️ (HuH), in at least two of these scenarios: Someone who is sitting down, Someone who is standing up, Someone who is approaching
Use at least two Positive Personal Connectors (PPC’s) to get connected
Use at least one Positive Action Starter (PAS) before initiating task

8defe526-376c-4722-bdd6-a7a980bff25d.description: To receive this Champion 2 Pin Certification, learners have submitted skill demonstration recordings and been approved in a one-on-one session with a PAC Mentor. During Champion Course 2, attendees learned to adapt Positive Physical Approach™️ (PPA™️) for challenging situations and Hand-under-Hand®️ (HuH) for five specific tasks. In addition, attendees also learned and practiced the Visual, Verbal, and Touch (VVT) cues and Positive Action Starters (PAS).

Learners are able to explain observed adaptions of PAC techniques with the individual and/or possible adaptations that would be helpful for supporting the person.
